column4: hello :o) can you help me installing my x-years old eizo CRT-monitor in ubuntu v8.10? i want a bit more screenresolution than 640x480  :o(
you = someone
funnyly, after i installed my videodrivers for nvidia, the resolution droppped from 800 x 600. now im stuck with 640 x 480
and i can tell you, thats BIG on a 21" CRT ;o9
cant you set resolution via $nvidia-settings?
hm, consider me newbieish to ubuntu and linux. i do not know, wehre i would find that file $nvidia-settings
okies
i can acess that program, but cant set a different CRT in the settings there. i DO know, that that CRT can handle 1280x1024. maybe if i edit that configfile directrly?
try nvidia-xconfig and restart Xorg
will do
precede it with sudo
if not you will have to edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf file manually
i preceded it with sudo, making the command look as "sudo nvidia-xconfig" but ntohing happens, no feedback whatsoever
yes. you must restart X. i believe it writes the settings it recognizes
im not sure i understand, i must restart ubuntu before giving the sudo xconfig command?
you must exit the windowed mode and start it anew before it takes effect
okay.
no need to restart...
sorry, i meant not del but backspace
examine your /etc/X11/xorg.conf
yes but i believe ubuntu has graphic login manager running still... not sure if you must exit that TOO or not
okay, i just restart the pc ( its not this one )
